publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-5157 Marilyn Livingstone: Safe Drive Stay Alive—That the Parliament commends the Fife Community Safety Partnership and its commitment to reducing casualties on Fife roads through its educational Safe Drive Stay Alive initiative; recognises that the campaign delivers a theatre-style performance that focuses on the emotional impact that a road traffic collision has on emergency service personnel, accident victims and their families; welcomes the fact that, in an attempt to reach young people before they begin to drive, the initiative is aimed at all fifth year pupils and those likely to leave after fourth year; notes that last year over 5,000 young people saw the road show, and wishes the initiative every success as it is replicated around Scotland to educate young people.

S3M-5157 Safe Drive Stay Alive (lodged on 9 November 2009) Iain Smith*, James Kelly*, Bill Butler*, Elaine Murray*, Bill Kidd*, Mary Mulligan*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Trish Godman*, Jim Tolson*, Robin Harper*
S3M-5157 Safe Drive Stay Alive (lodged on 9 November 2009) John Park*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Jackie Baillie*, Des McNulty*, Tricia Marwick*, Margaret Mitchell*, George Foulkes*, Hugh Henry*
S3M-5157 Safe Drive Stay Alive (lodged on 9 November 2009) Gil Paterson*

S3M-5157 Marilyn Livingstone: Safe Drive Stay Alive—That the Parliament commends the Fife Community Safety Partnership and its commitment to reducing casualties on Fife roads through its educational Safe Drive Stay Alive initiative; recognises that the campaign delivers a theatre-style performance that focuses on the emotional impact that a road traffic collision has on emergency service personnel, accident victims and their families; welcomes the fact that, in an attempt to reach young people before they begin to drive, the initiative is aimed at all fifth year pupils and those likely to leave after fourth year; notes that last year over 5,000 young people saw the road show, and wishes the initiative every success as it is replicated around Scotland to educate young people. Supported by: Iain Smith, James Kelly, Bill Butler, Elaine Murray, Bill Kidd, Mary Mulligan, Hugh O’Donnell, Trish Godman, Jim Tolson, Robin Harper, John Park, Mr Frank McAveety, Jackie Baillie, Des McNulty, Tricia Marwick, Margaret Mitchell, George Foulkes, Hugh Henry, Gil Paterson
S3M-5157 Safe Drive Stay Alive (lodged on 9 November 2009) Sarah Boyack*, Alison McInnes*, Helen Eadie*, Karen Whitefield*
